msDesc.head: Willelmus de Monte Lauduno, De sacramentis; Giovanni Calderini, Tabulae auctoritatum et sententiarum Bibliae; canon law; etc. Germany (?Erfurt), late 14th or early 15th century.

msItem.note: After fol. ii is a fifteenth-century table of contents (lifted from a pastedown or endleaf), with ex libris, listing as the first item, now missing, 'Concordancie breuissime ex biblia contra aliqua vicia'. This presumably refers to one of the removed endleaves (see below).

msItem.author: Willelmus de Monte Lauduno
msItem.title: De sacramentis
msItem.incipit: Karissimo filio suo ac socio speciali domino ... Presens opus dilecti
Signatum est super nos Hoc ergo signum luminosum vultu dei signatum
msItem.explicit: ut accedat quod legitur extra de baptismo maiores circa medium de con. di. i. nullus cum similibus etc. AMEN.
msItem.finalRubric: [later hand] Explicit Willelmus de Monte Lauduno de sacramentis
msItem.note: Rest of fol. 87vb blank.
Three items presented as if comprising a single text on confession:

msItem.title: Summa de poenitentia
msItem.incipit: Qvonima circa confessiones animarum pericula sunt et quandoque difficultates emergunt. Ideo ad honorem dei sanctique Nycolai
(brief index, fol. 88ra) Quo tempore incepit confessio p. 1
Videamus quo tempore incepit confessio et de hoc sunt quinque opiniones
msItem.note: Bloomfield 4919; Kaeppeli 3184; pr. in Bibliotheca Casinensis (1873–94), 4. 191–215. Variously attributed in the manuscripts, which preserve different versions: see H. Weisweiler, 'Handschriftliches zur Summa de penitentia des Mag. Paulus von St. Nicolaus', Scholastik 5 (1930), 248–260. The text here agrees with the printed edition as far as the chapter 'de impedimentis confessionum', ending (fol. 94ra) 'non sum sicud ceteri homines' (ed. p. 201, col. 2, lines 11–12). There then follow chapters 'De desperatione' (beginning 'Sequitur de desparacione et est sciendum quod duplex est desperacio...') and 'De principalibus vitiis' (ending 'mora, delectatio, sensus'). The same version is found in Augsburg, UB, Cod. II. 1.2o 143, and Munich, BSB, Clm 3596, for which see below, arts. 2.3 and 7.
Bookmark (?) (fragment of another paper manuscript) between fols. 93 and 94.

msItem.title: Sermon
msItem.incipit: Descendens iesus de monte. Luc. vj. Primo notandum est quid sit mons de quo descendit, 2º qualiter descendit, 3º ad quid descendit. Nota quod mons est triplex
msItem.explicit: 4º descendit ad liberandum bonos, Can. vj dilectus meus descendit in ortum ut lilia colligat

title.supplied: Peccata cordis, oris, operis, et omissionis

msItem.incipit: Peccata cordis sunt hec, cogitacio, delectatio, consensus, desiderium mali, voluntas peruersa
msItem.explicit: afflictos non consolari, admonicionibus non acquiescere
msItem.note: Cf. Bloomfield 3760; also in Augsburg, UB, Cod. II. 1.2o 143, directly following Paulus de Hungaria, and with a similar final rubric ('Explicit tractatus breuis de speciebus confessionis edite Bononie per reuerendum magistrum Iohannem Andree'). To be distinguished from the similar text of Simone Fidati, Peccata cordis, oris, operis, et omissionis (Bloomfield 845).

msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus de speciebus confessionum editus
msItem.note: Rest of fol. 96vb blank. Fol. 96v ruled, blank.

msItem.author: Giovanni Calderini
msItem.title: Tabulae auctoritatum et sententiarum Bibliae cum concordantiis decretorum et decretalium
msItem.incipit: Seriem huius tabule continentem auctoritates et sentencias biblie
Aaron. aaron post conflatum vitulum in summum sacerdotem est concecratus. Exo 32. Aaron in episcopum et filios eius
msItem.explicit: Zizania. dicetur messoribus colligere zizaniam et alligare fasciculos ad comburendum
msItem.finalRubric:
Explicit tabula auctoritatum et sententiarum biblie inductarum in compilacionibus doctorum et decretalium quotarum domini Johannis Caldr. doctories decretorum etc.
Explicit tabula domini Johannis caldrini excellentis doctorum doctoris.

msItem.incipit: In hoc tractatu tractatur primo descripcione interdicti ecclesiastici cum declaracione membrorum. Secundo de speciebus interdicti.
msItem.explicit: Octagesimo 9o de eukaristia. Nonagesimo an sane dampnatis ad mortem tempore interdicti possit dari eukaristia
msItem.note: Index to the following item; cf. a different text in MS. Hamilton 23, fols. 188vb-191va.

msItem.author: Giovanni Calderini
msItem.title: De interdicto ecclesiastico
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus Johannis Caldrinij de Interdicto
msItem.incipit: Quamvis dubia plura iuxta materiam interdicti
msItem.explicit: concessa ipsi ecclesie a christo cui est honor et gloria in secula seculorum. Amen.

msItem.incipit: In capitulo quesiuit de hiis que fiunt ama. per ca. recitantur infrascripta per modum summe sic distingwendo de interdicto ecclesiastico
msItem.explicit: in Ecclesia kathedrali que non fuerat sibi subiecta ergo non tenuit
msItem.note: Described in the table of contents as 'distinctio de interdicto'.

msItem.author: John XXII
msItem.title: Extrauagantes: Suscepti regiminis
msItem.note: Extrav. Jo. XXII 2.1, Corpus Iuris Canonici II.1205–6.

msItem.author: Boniface VIII
msItem.title: Decretal: Provide attendentes
msItem.note: Extrav. commun. V.10.2, Corpus Iuris Canonici II.1310.

msItem.author: Urban V
msItem.title: Decretal: Ne in vinea
msItem.note: Extrav. commun. 5.1.1, Corpus Iuris Canonici II.1287–8.

msItem.author: Giovanni Calderini (?)
msItem.title: Summa abbreviata de ecclesiastico interdicto
msItem.incipit: Ecclesiasticum interdictum est suspensio ecclesiastice censure a diuinis officiis
msItem.explicit: Quod dampnatis eukaristia debet dari vide c. Fures de furtis
msItem.note: Attributed to Calderini in other manuscripts, for which see H. Hilg, Lateinische mittelalterliche Handschriften in Folio der Universitätsbibliothek Augsburg: Cod. II. 1.2o 91–226 (Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz, 1999), 196 (on Cod. II. 1.2o 143); E. Rauner, Katalog der lateinischen Handschriften der Bayerischen Staatsbibliothek München, Clm 3501–3661, (2007), 474 (on Clm 3596).

msItem.title: De horis canonicis
msItem.rubric: Sequitur quomodo hore canonice sunt dicende tractatus Johannis Andreae
msItem.incipit: Hore canonice secundum Gil. de Monte Landuno de celebratione missarum c. i. in Clementinis super verbo
msItem.explicit: diuina clemencia de actu de hiis
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt opiniones de horis canonicis dicendis
msItem.note: See Hilg, Handschriften ... Augsburg 185–6, and Rauner, Handschriften ... München, 474, as cited in the previous note. Anonymous in the other manuscripts.

msItem.title: Formulary of legal process for a court in Thuringia
msItem.incipit: Coram vobis honorabilibus viris dominis iudicibus generalibus per Thuringiam constitutis dicit et in iuris conquerendo proponit dominus Johannes Phlucr. vicarius etc actor
msItem.note: Breaks off unfinished (?). Described as 'processus iudicii exemplariter' in the list of contents.

msItem.author: Johannes Andreae
msItem.title: Summa super quarto libro decretalium siue summa de sponsalibus
msItem.incipit: Cristi nomine inuocans ad honorem ipsius et reuerendissimi patris mei
(fol. 201vb) Sponsolia proprie sunt de futuro et dicuntur futura nupciarum promissio
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit summa iiijti libri decretalium domini Johannis Andree
msItem.note: As pr. [Basel, c. 1473–5] (GW 1751 )

msItem.author: Johannes Andreae
msItem.title: Apparatus in Clementinas: gloss on Saepe contingit
msItem.rubric: Incipit glosa super decretalem sepe contingit
msItem.incipit: Sepe contingit Quoniam secundum quintilianum libro viij de oratorio institucione optimarum rerum inuencio
msItem.explicit: per intercessionem virginis gloriose nos collocet cum electis amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit glosa Johannis Andree super nouas constituciones per dominum clementem papam v editas in consilio viennensi
msItem.note: As printed in the edition of 1582, cols. 332–342. Fol. 208vb, 'refer duo folia et inuenies residuum'; the break is at the section of gloss beginning 'Litis contestactionem' (ed. 1582, col. 335)
Interrupted by:

msItem.title: Constitutiones Clementinae: Saepe contingit
msItem.note: Clem. 5.11.2, Corpus Iuris Canonici II.1200

msItem.author: John XXII
msItem.title: Extravagantes: Execrabilis
msItem.note: Extravag. Joh. XXII. tit. 3, Corpus Iuris Canonici II.1207–9. Rest of fol. 210vb blank.
(extract)
msItem.incipit: Prudencia. Quatuor sunt que prudencia nos edocet, preterita recolere, penitencia disponere, futura prouidere, et dubia suspendere. Fortitudo.
msItem.explicit: Quatuor sunt que pacis conseruatori expediunt, alienum non inuadere et habere pacienciam, fidem colere et in cunctis iusticiam conseruare
msItem.note: Bloomfield 4455, here most of cc. 1–2. Cf. Bloomfield 4449 (attrib. Franciscus de Asculo / Petrobonus de Mantua).

msItem.title: Priuilegia clericorum
msItem.rubric: Isti sunt priuilegia clericorum et sunt xxv
msItem.incipit: Primum quod percuciens clericum est excommunicatus xvij q. iiij Si quis
msItem.explicit: Item si loca transferuntur uel vniantur retinent priuilegia xvj. q. j. Si vere

msItem.note: Additions, 15th century. Both items also in Clm 3596 and Augsburg II.1.2o 143: see Hilg, op. cit, 185 and Rauner, op. cit., 474, noting other copies.

supportDesc.support: Paper, folded in folio. Watermarks: bull's head with six-petalled flower, cf. Piccard xii.231; bull's head with six-petalled flower, cf. WZIS DE1335-PO-65332, etc. (1397 etc.); stag's head with five-petalled flower, not resembling Piccard ii.385–7, close to WZIS DE5580-Clm3086_1 (1397)
supportDesc.collation: 1(12)-3(12) (fols. 1–36), 4(12–1: 7 canc. after fol. 43) (fols. 37–47), 5(12)-7(12) (fols. 48–83), 8(14–1: 14 canc. after fol. 96) (fols. 84–96), 9(12)-18(12) (fols. 97–216). Catchwords; quires numbered in arabic on the upper centre of the opening recto.

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., c. 39–46 lines. Frame-ruled, ruled space 215–20 145 with c. 18 mm. between columns.

handDesc.handNote: Cursive by two scribes, (a) fols. 1–201va, (b) fols. 201va-215rb. Addition on fols. 215va-216vb by hand a or a third hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Coloured red initials mostly of 2–3 lines sometimes with simple decoration. Rubrication and decoration unfinished, fols. 200-end.

binding.p: Fifteenth-century binding of tawed skin over boards; damaged and repaired; contemporary contents label. Rebacked. Tabs.

physDesc.accMat: Endleaves removed: one (acts of a German law court, 1376) is now MS. Lat. misc. b. 12 fol. 58, the other (theological treatise) currently untraced.

history.provenance: Fols. 200ra-201va suggest an origin in Thuringia.

Erfurt, Charterhouse: typical fifteenth-century table of contents, with ex libris; another fifteenth-century ex libris, fol. 119r; catalogue, A 30 (Mittelalterliche Bibliothekskataloge Deutschlands ... II.255); 17th-century (?) ex libris, fol. 1r.
Friedrich Gottlieb Julius von Bülow: identifiable as no. 206 in the 1836 sale catalogue.
history.acquisition: Presented to the Bodleian Library by his sons and received in 1857.

recordHist.source: Description by Matthew Holford (June-Nov. 2020). Previously described in the Summary Catalogue. Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 22 Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 23

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project
